00014 // Construction/Destruction
00016 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00017 Thread::Thread(bool autostart, const SimpleString Name /* = SimpleString::EmptyString */)
00018 #else
00019 Thread::Thread(bool autostart)
00020 #endif
00021 {
00022 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00023     ThreadName = Name;
00024 #endif
00025 
00026
00027 #ifdef WIN32
00028     ThreadID = 0;
00029     ThreadHandle  = NULL;
00030 #endif
00031 
00032     ThreadIsRunning = false;
00033     StopWasAsked = false;
00034
00035     if (autostart)
00036         StartThread();
00037 }
00038
00039 Thread::~Thread()
00040 {
00041     if(IsRunning())
00042     {
00043         StopThread();
00044     }
00045 }
00046
00047 bool Thread::StartThread()
00048 {
00049     // do nothing if already running
00050     if ( IsRunning() )
00051     {
00052         return false;
00053     }
00054
00055     ThreadIsRunning = false;
00056     StopWasAsked = false;
00057
00058 #ifdef WIN32
00059     ThreadID = 0;
00060     ThreadHandle = CreateThread( NULL, 0, CallRun, (void*)this, 0, &ThreadID );
00061     return (ThreadHandle != NULL);
00062 #else
00063     pthread_attr_t attr;
00064     pthread_attr_init(&attr);
00065     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00066     int rc = pthread_create(&m_thread, &attr, CallRun, this);
00067     pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
00068     return (rc == 0);
00069 #endif
00070 }
00071
00072 bool Thread::StopThread(int wait_ms)
00073 {
00074     bool ThreadStopInTime = true;
00075
00076     if (IsRunning())
00077     {
00078         // Notify thread !
00079         StopWasAsked = true;            // Notification for pseudo active waiting
00080         StopWasAskedEvent.Signal();        // other notification
00081
00082         ThreadStopInTime = IsEnded.Wait(wait_ms);
00083         if ( ThreadStopInTime == false )
00084         {
00085             // Timeout !!!
00086             OmiscidError( "Thread::StopThread: Thread do not stop before timeout (%d).\n", wait_ms );
00087
00088             // Destroy the thread...
00089 #ifdef WIN32
00090             // TerminateThread( ThreadHandle, 0 );
00091             ThreadID = 0;
00092             ThreadHandle  = NULL;
00093 #else
00094             // pthread_cancel(m_thread);
00095 #endif
00096         }
00097     }
00098
00099     return ThreadStopInTime;
00100 }
00101
00102 #ifdef WIN32
00103 unsigned long FUNCTION_CALL_TYPE Thread::CallRun(void* ptr)
00104 #else
00105 void* Thread::CallRun(void* ptr)
00106 #endif
00107 {
00108     Thread* t = (Thread*)ptr;
00109
00110     // init thread random generator
00111     RandomInit();
00112
00113     // Reset stat event
00114     t->IsEnded.Reset();
00115
00116 #ifdef DEBUG_THREAD
00117     // OmiscidTrace( "%s\n", t->ThreadName.GetStr() );
00118 #endif
00119 
00120     // Do my job
00121     t->ThreadIsRunning = true;
00122     t->Run();
00123     t->ThreadIsRunning = false;
00124
00125 #ifdef WIN32
00126 
00127     // Close the Thread handle
00128     // CloseHandle( ThreadHandle );
00129
00130     t->ThreadID = 0;
00131     t->ThreadHandle = NULL;
00132 #else
00133     // m_thread    : something to do with ?
00134 #endif
00135 
00136     // signal, my job is over
00137     t->IsEnded.Signal();
00138
00139 #ifdef WIN32
00140     return 0;
00141 #else
00142     pthread_exit(NULL);
00143 #endif
00144 }
00145
00146 void Thread::Sleep(int nb_ms)
00147 {
00148 #ifdef WIN32
00149     // Use SleepEx because accuracy of the wait time is better than with ::Sleep
00150     ::SleepEx(nb_ms, FALSE);
00151 #else
00152     usleep(nb_ms*1000);
00153 #endif
00154 }
00155
00156 bool Thread::IsRunning() const
00157 {
00158     return ThreadIsRunning;
00159 }
00160
00161 bool Thread::StopPending() const
00162 {
00163     return StopWasAsked;
00164 }
00165
00166 void Thread::WaitForStop()
00167 {
00168     StopWasAskedEvent.Wait(0);
00169 }
